snippet: Rights groups said the juxtaposition underscored the persistent doubts about the government’s pledges to steer Egypt toward a new era of freedom and democracy after the military’s ouster of Mohamed Morsi.
abstract: Egypt's official news media says the new constitution revised after military takeover is headed to ratification by more than 95 percent of votes cast, even as authorities step up crackdown on journalists and dissenters that human rights groups say belies charter's promises of free speech.
lead_paragraph: Rights groups said the juxtaposition underscored the persistent doubts about the government’s pledges to steer Egypt toward a new era of freedom and democracy after the military’s ouster of Mohamed Morsi.

headline.main: Egypt’s Crackdown Belies Constitution as It Nears Approval
headline.print_headline: Egypt’s Crackdown Belies Constitution as It Nears Approval
